14#include <config.h>
15
16/*! \file
17 * \brief
18 * Obtain the list of network interfaces using the getifaddrs(3) library.
19 */
20
21#include <stdbool.h>
22
23#include <ifaddrs.h>
24
25#include <isc/strerr.h>
26
27/*% Iterator Magic */
28#define IFITER_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('I', 'F', 'I', 'G')
29/*% Valid Iterator */
30#define VALID_IFITER(t) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(t, IFITER_MAGIC)
31
32#ifdef __linux
33static bool seenv6 = false;
34#endif
35
36/*% Iterator structure */
37struct isc_interfaceiter {
38 unsigned int magic; /*%< Magic number. */
39 isc_mem_t *mctx;
40 void *buf; /*%< (unused) */
41 unsigned int bufsize; /*%< (always 0) */
42 struct ifaddrs *ifaddrs; /*%< List of ifaddrs */
43 struct ifaddrs *pos; /*%< Ptr to current ifaddr */
44 isc_interface_t current; /*%< Current interface data. */
45 isc_result_t result; /*%< Last result code. */
46#ifdef __linux
47 FILE * proc;
48 char entry[ISC_IF_INET6_SZ];
49 isc_result_t valid;
50#endif
51};
52
53isc_result_t
54isc_interfaceiter_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_interfaceiter_t **iterp) {
55 isc_interfaceiter_t *iter;
56 isc_result_t result;
57 char strbuf[ISC_STRERRORSIZE];
58
59 REQUIRE(mctx != NULL);
60 REQUIRE(iterp != NULL);
61 REQUIRE(*iterp == NULL);
62
63 iter = isc_mem_get(mctx, sizeof(*iter));
64 if (iter == NULL)
65 return (ISC_R_NOMEMORY);
66
67 iter->mctx = mctx;
68 iter->buf = NULL;
69 iter->bufsize = 0;
70 iter->ifaddrs = NULL;
71#ifdef __linux
72 /*
73 * Only open "/proc/net/if_inet6" if we have never seen a IPv6
74 * address returned by getifaddrs().
75 */
76 if (!seenv6)
77 iter->proc = fopen("/proc/net/if_inet6", "r");
78 else
79 iter->proc = NULL;
80 iter->valid = ISC_R_FAILURE;
81#endif
82
83 if (getifaddrs(&iter->ifaddrs) < 0) {
84 strerror_r(errno, strbuf, sizeof(strbuf));
85 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
86 "getting interface addresses: getifaddrs: %s",
87 strbuf);
88 result = ISC_R_UNEXPECTED;
89 goto failure;
90 }
91
92 /*
93 * A newly created iterator has an undefined position
94 * until isc_interfaceiter_first() is called.
95 */
96 iter->pos = NULL;
97 iter->result = ISC_R_FAILURE;
98
99 iter->magic = IFITER_MAGIC;
100 *iterp = iter;
101 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
102
103 failure:
104#ifdef __linux
105 if (iter->proc != NULL)
106 fclose(iter->proc);
107#endif
108 if (iter->ifaddrs != NULL) /* just in case */
109 freeifaddrs(iter->ifaddrs);
110 isc_mem_put(mctx, iter, sizeof(*iter));
111 return (result);
112}
113
114/*
115 * Get information about the current interface to iter->current.
116 * If successful, return ISC_R_SUCCESS.
117 * If the interface has an unsupported address family,
118 * return ISC_R_IGNORE.
119 */
120
121static isc_result_t
122internal_current(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
123 struct ifaddrs *ifa;
124 int family;
125 unsigned int namelen;
126
127 REQUIRE(VALID_IFITER(iter));
128
129 ifa = iter->pos;
130
131#ifdef __linux
132 if (iter->pos == NULL)
133 return (linux_if_inet6_current(iter));
134#endif
135
136 INSIST(ifa != NULL);
137 INSIST(ifa->ifa_name != NULL);
138
139 if (ifa->ifa_addr == NULL)
140 return (ISC_R_IGNORE);
141
142 family = ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family;
143 if (family != AF_INET && family != AF_INET6)
144 return (ISC_R_IGNORE);
145
146#ifdef __linux
147 if (family == AF_INET6)
148 seenv6 = true;
149#endif
150
151 memset(&iter->current, 0, sizeof(iter->current));
152
153 namelen = strlen(ifa->ifa_name);
154 if (namelen > sizeof(iter->current.name) - 1)
155 namelen = sizeof(iter->current.name) - 1;
156
157 memset(iter->current.name, 0, sizeof(iter->current.name));
158 memmove(iter->current.name, ifa->ifa_name, namelen);
159
160 iter->current.flags = 0;
161
162 if ((ifa->ifa_flags & IFF_UP) != 0)
163 iter->current.flags |= INTERFACE_F_UP;
164
165 if ((ifa->ifa_flags & IFF_POINTOPOINT) != 0)
166 iter->current.flags |= INTERFACE_F_POINTTOPOINT;
167
168 if ((ifa->ifa_flags & IFF_LOOPBACK) != 0)
169 iter->current.flags |= INTERFACE_F_LOOPBACK;
170
171 iter->current.af = family;
172
173 get_addr(family, &iter->current.address, ifa->ifa_addr, ifa->ifa_name);
174
175 if (ifa->ifa_netmask != NULL)
176 get_addr(family, &iter->current.netmask, ifa->ifa_netmask,
177 ifa->ifa_name);
178
179 if (ifa->ifa_dstaddr != NULL &&
180 (iter->current.flags & INTERFACE_F_POINTTOPOINT) != 0)
181 get_addr(family, &iter->current.dstaddress, ifa->ifa_dstaddr,
182 ifa->ifa_name);
183
184 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
185}
186
187/*
188 * Step the iterator to the next interface. Unlike
189 * isc_interfaceiter_next(), this may leave the iterator
190 * positioned on an interface that will ultimately
191 * be ignored. Return ISC_R_NOMORE if there are no more
192 * interfaces, otherwise ISC_R_SUCCESS.
193 */
194static isc_result_t
195internal_next(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
196
197 if (iter->pos != NULL)
198 iter->pos = iter->pos->ifa_next;
199 if (iter->pos == NULL) {
200#ifdef __linux
201 if (!seenv6)
202 return (linux_if_inet6_next(iter));
203#endif
204 return (ISC_R_NOMORE);
205 }
206
207 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
208}
209
210static void
211internal_destroy(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
212
213#ifdef __linux
214 if (iter->proc != NULL)
215 fclose(iter->proc);
216 iter->proc = NULL;
217#endif
218 if (iter->ifaddrs)
219 freeifaddrs(iter->ifaddrs);
220 iter->ifaddrs = NULL;
221}
222
223static
224void internal_first(isc_interfaceiter_t *iter) {
225
226#ifdef __linux
227 linux_if_inet6_first(iter);
228#endif
229 iter->pos = iter->ifaddrs;
230}
